name: Feeding America
description: Works to end hunger in the United States through a network of food banks and meal programs.

name: United Way Worldwide
description: Supports communities in health, education, and financial stability through local organizations.

name: Goodwill Industries International
description: Provides job training and employment services to individuals facing barriers to employment.

name: Salvation Army USA
description: Offers a range of social services, including food assistance, shelter, and disaster relief.

name: American Red Cross
description: Provides disaster relief, blood donation, and health and safety training services.

name: Boys & Girls Clubs of America
description: Offers youth development programs and activities to empower young people.

name: Big Brothers Big Sisters of America
description: Provides mentoring programs for children facing adversity.

name: Habitat for Humanity International
description: Builds safe, decent, and affordable housing for those in need worldwide.

name: Feeding Children Everywhere
description: Works to end childhood hunger through meal packing and distribution programs.

name: Operation Gratitude
description: Supports military and first responder communities with care packages and letters of appreciation.

name: Doctors Without Borders (Médecins Sans Frontières)
description: Provides medical care and humanitarian aid to communities affected by crises.

name: Boys Town
description: Supports at-risk youth and families through a continuum of care.

name: Make-A-Wish Foundation
description: Grants wishes to children with critical illnesses to provide hope and joy.

name: Planned Parenthood Federation of America
description: Provides healthcare and education on reproductive and sexual health.

name: Susan G. Komen for the Cure
description: Fights breast cancer through research, education, and support services.

name: Huntington's Disease Society of America
description: Supports individuals and families affected by Huntington's disease through research and services.

name: Special Olympics
description: Empowers individuals with intellectual disabilities through sports and inclusion programs.

name: National Multiple Sclerosis Society
description: Supports individuals affected by multiple sclerosis through research and services.

name: American Cancer Society
description: Fights cancer through research, education, and support programs.

name: Boys & Girls Clubs of America
description: Offers youth development programs and activities to empower young people.
